name: radicle-httpd
desc: A Radicle HTTP daemon exposing a JSON HTTP API that allows someone to browse local repositories on a Radicle node via their web browser.

options.name: checkConfig
options.desc: Whether to enable checking the config.json file resulting from services.radicle.settings.

options.name: enable
options.desc: Whether to enable Radicle Seed Node.

options.name: httpd.enable
options.desc: Whether to enable Radicle HTTP gateway to radicle-node.

options.name: httpd.extraArgs
options.desc: Extra arguments for radicle-httpd

options.name: httpd.listenAddress
options.desc: The IP address on which radicle-httpd listens.

options.name: httpd.listenPort
options.desc: The port on which radicle-httpd listens.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: httpd.nginx
options.desc: With this option, you can customize an nginx virtual host which already has sensible defaults for radicle-httpd. Set to {} if you do not need any customization to the virtual host. If enabled, then by default, the serverName is radicle-${config.networking.hostName}.${config.networking.domain}, TLS is active, and certificates are acquired via ACME. If this is set to null (the default), no nginx virtual host will be configured.

options.name: httpd.nginx.acmeFallbackHost
options.desc: Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name. With this option, you could request certificates for the present domain with an ACME client that is running on another host, which you would specify here.

options.name: httpd.nginx.acmeRoot
options.desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is public. Don’t put certs or keys in here. Set to null to inherit from config.security.acme.

options.name: httpd.nginx.addSSL
options.desc: Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for listen to listen on all interfaces on the respective default ports (80, 443).

options.name: httpd.nginx.basicAuth
options.desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost. WARNING: This is implemented to store the password in plain text in the Nix store.

options.name: httpd.nginx.basicAuthFile
options.desc: Basic Auth password file for a vhost. Can be created via: htpasswd -c <filename> <username>. WARNING: The generate file contains the users’ passwords in a non-cryptographically-securely hashed way.

options.name: httpd.nginx.default
options.desc: Makes this vhost the default.

options.name: httpd.nginx.enableACME
options.desc: Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost. Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through useACMEHost.

options.name: httpd.nginx.extraConfig
options.desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

options.name: httpd.nginx.forceSSL
options.desc: Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults to 301, configurable with redirectCode) all plain HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This will set defaults for listen to listen on all interfaces on the respective default ports (80, 443), where the non-SSL listens are used for the redirect vhosts.

options.name: httpd.nginx.globalRedirect
options.desc: If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301, configurable with redirectCode) to the given hostname.

options.name: httpd.nginx.http2
options.desc: Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol. Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given IP address / port. If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is enabled for all server blocks on this IP. See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

options.name: httpd.nginx.http3
options.desc: Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol. This requires using pkgs.nginxQuic package which can be achieved by setting services.nginx.package = pkgs.nginxQuic; and activate the QUIC transport protocol services.nginx.virtualHosts.<name>.quic = true;. Note that HTTP/3 support is experimental and not yet recommended for production. Read more at https://quic.nginx.org/ HTTP/3 availability must be manually advertised, preferably in each location block.

options.name: httpd.nginx.http3_hq
options.desc: Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests. This requires using pkgs.nginxQuic package which can be achieved by setting services.nginx.package = pkgs.nginxQuic; and activate the QUIC transport protocol services.nginx.virtualHosts.<name>.quic = true;. Note that special application protocol support is experimental and not yet recommended for production. Read more at https://quic.nginx.org/

options.name: httpd.nginx.kTLS
options.desc: Whether to enable kTLS support. Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel. Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

options.name: httpd.nginx.listen
options.desc: Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host. IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets. Note: this option overrides addSSL and onlySSL. If you only want to set the addresses manually and not the ports, take a look at listenAddresses.

options.name: httpd.nginx.listen.*.addr
options.desc: Listen address.

options.name: httpd.nginx.listen.*.extraParameters
options.desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

options.name: httpd.nginx.listen.*.port
options.desc: Port number to listen on. If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: httpd.nginx.listen.*.proxyProtocol
options.desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

options.name: httpd.nginx.listen.*.ssl
options.desc: Enable SSL.

options.name: httpd.nginx.listenAddresses
options.desc: Listen addresses for this virtual host. Compared to listen this only sets the addresses and the ports are chosen automatically. Note: This option overrides enableIPv6

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations
options.desc: Declarative location config

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.alias
options.desc: Alias directory for requests.

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.basicAuth
options.desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost. WARNING: This is implemented to store the password in plain text in the Nix store.

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.basicAuthFile
options.desc: Basic Auth password file for a vhost. Can be created via: htpasswd -c <filename> <username>. WARNING: The generate file contains the users’ passwords in a non-cryptographically-securely hashed way.

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.extraConfig
options.desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.fastcgiParams
options.desc: FastCGI parameters to override. Unlike in the Nginx configuration file, overriding only some default parameters won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.index
options.desc: Adds index directive.

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.priority
options.desc: Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost. The semantics are the same as with lib.mkOrder. Smaller values have a greater priority.

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.proxyPass
options.desc: Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.proxyWebsockets
options.desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.recommendedProxySettings
options.desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.return
options.desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
options.type: null or string or signed integer

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.root
options.desc: Root directory for requests.

options.name: httpd.nginx.locations.<name>.tryFiles
options.desc: Adds try_files directive.

options.name: httpd.nginx.onlySSL
options.desc: Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set defaults for listen to listen on all interfaces on port 443.

options.name: httpd.nginx.quic
options.desc: Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol. This requires using pkgs.nginxQuic package which can be achieved by setting services.nginx.package = pkgs.nginxQuic;. Note that QUIC support is experimental and not yet recommended for production. Read more at https://quic.nginx.org/

options.name: httpd.nginx.redirectCode
options.desc: HTTP status used by globalRedirect and forceSSL. Possible usecases include temporary (302, 307) redirects, keeping the request method and body (307, 308), or explicitly resetting the method to GET (303). See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Redirections.

options.name: httpd.nginx.rejectSSL
options.desc: Whether to listen for and reject all HTTPS connections to this vhost. Useful in default server blocks to avoid serving the certificate for another vhost. Uses the ssl_reject_handshake directive available in nginx versions 1.19.4 and above.

options.name: httpd.nginx.reuseport
options.desc: Create an individual listening socket . It is required to specify only once on one of the hosts.

options.name: httpd.nginx.root
options.desc: The path of the web root directory.

options.name: httpd.nginx.serverAliases
options.desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

options.name: httpd.nginx.serverName
options.desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

options.name: httpd.nginx.sslCertificate
options.desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

options.name: httpd.nginx.sslCertificateKey
options.desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

options.name: httpd.nginx.sslTrustedCertificate
options.desc: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

options.name: httpd.nginx.useACMEHost
options.desc: A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use. This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the rate limit. Alternately, you can generate a certificate through enableACME. Note that this option does not create any certificates, nor it does add subdomains to existing ones – you will need to create them manually using security.acme.certs.

options.name: httpd.package
options.desc: The radicle-httpd package to use.

options.name: node.extraArgs
options.desc: Extra arguments for radicle-node

options.name: node.listenAddress
options.desc: The IP address on which radicle-node listens.

options.name: node.listenPort
options.desc: The port on which radicle-node listens.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: node.openFirewall
options.desc: Whether to enable opening the firewall for radicle-node.

options.name: package
options.desc: The radicle-node package to use.

options.name: privateKeyFile
options.desc: SSH private key generated by rad auth. If it contains a colon (:) the string before the colon is taken as the credential name and the string after as a path encrypted with systemd-creds.

options.name: publicKeyFile
options.desc: SSH public key generated by rad auth.

options.name: settings
options.desc: See https://app.radicle.xyz/nodes/seed.radicle.garden/rad:z3gqcJUoA1n9HaHKufZs5FCSGazv5/tree/radicle/src/node/config.rs#L275
